plugins.name: JACoB: AI CodeGen Connector
plugins.description: Transform your Figma designs into React components effortlessly with JACoB: CodeGen Connector. This plugin bridges the gap between design and development by enabling a direct connection to your GitHub repositories with the JACoB GitHub bot. Simply authenticate with GitHub, link your repos, and select design elements in Figma. Provide additional instructions if needed, and with a single click, initiate the automated code generation process in GitHub. JACoB's AI-driven technology ensures the generated React code aligns with your project's style and framework, streamlining your development workflow. Note: JACoB requires a subscription for the GitHub bot integration.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Convert Figma Designs to Production-Level React Code Directly to GitHub PRs

plugins.name: Share links
plugins.description:
Hot it works


1. Copy one link to the necessary file.

2. Select a frame or multiple frames, or even a section with frames.

3. Choose settings if needed and click the "Copy to clipboard" button.


Done! You get the structured list of section and frame links.
plugins.tagline: Quickly share multiple frame links with just a few clicks

plugins.name: Bluebrint Plugin
plugins.description:
Sync your design with Blueprint


Steps:

  1. Select a frame. The frame is going to be synchronized.
  2. Click "EXPORT" button. It will opens Blueprint in Web browser.
  3. Select a Blueprint project.
  4. Accept the consent screen. Blueprint requires READ permissions of the Figma file.
  5. You are ready to refer the frame from Blueprint!
plugins.tagline: Boost your design oriented development process.

plugins.name: Wormhole Tunnels
plugins.description:
Looking for a plugin that can help you generate round tunnels?


Introducing Wormhole Tunnels!


How it works:

  1. Open the Wormhole Tunnels plugin.
  2. Play with these parameters:
  3. Twist/Spiral (Range: 0-360)
  4. Contraction/Expansion (Range: 0-100)
  5. Radial Lines (Range: 5-50)
  6. Concentric Rings (Range: 5-30)
  7. Depth/Stretch (Range: 0-200)
  8. Warp/Distortion (Range: 0-100)
  9. Adjust the stroke width and color, and click on "Generate".
  10. Your pattern is ready!


NO login/signup required!


Feel free to reach out in case of any doubts, bugs or new feature improvements!
plugins.tagline: A plugin that helps you generate wormhole tunnels from any shape!

plugins.name: OK Palette
plugins.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the paletteâ€™s path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.

plugins.name: Text Repeat Grid
plugins.description:
Introducing the "Text Repeat Grid" Plugin for Figma


This plug-in was primarily created to make working with tables and repeating elements / grid layouts with text a lot easier and faster. However you can use it for many other things as well, like e.g. copying text from a group to a component (using the â€œGet Text From Selectionâ€ feature) and pasting it to a component or vice versa, create variations by randomizing table column data etc.


In conjunction with Figma core features, it provides a replacement for the amazing Adobe XD â€œRepeat Gridâ€ feature.


Hopefully this plug-in will revolutionize the way you manage text in your designs. Here's how it can help you streamline your workflow:


Manual Input & Text File Upload

- Whether you're typing directly into the text input field or uploading a text file, this feature allows you to populate selected text frames quickly. Simply enter your text or upload a file, and each line of text will be automatically distributed to your selected text frames in the order they appear in the layers panel.

* Create realistic layouts by using text that makes sense

* Use your favourite software or AI chat bot to create content

* Each line will be filled in a separate text layer of your current selection

* e.g. user names, dates, locations, headlines, labels, tags etc.


Spreadsheet Input

Need to fill a table like-structure? The spreadsheet feature lets you drag and drop a spreadsheet file to fill text frames across multiple columns and rows simultaneously. Just remember, your text frames need to be organized in a table-like structure in Figma â€“ think of nesting your text cells in rows or columns. Make sure you select all related columns or rows before applying the text.

You can select between a column-first and a row-first structure to fill the data according to your layer architecture.


This feature shines in scenarios like setting up a multi-field form or a dashboard where data is organized in grids. It ensures that each piece of data lands exactly where it's supposed to, across both rows and columns, saving you the hassle of manual entry.


Randomize Input

With a simple toggle, you can randomize the order of your text inputs. This is particularly useful when you want to experiment with different orders, create variations, or make the same data not look repetitive, without rearranging text manually.


Get Text from Selection

If you need to repurpose or edit text already placed in your designs, this feature makes it a breeze. Just select the text frames you want to edit, and the plugin will pull the text from each frame, allowing you to quickly make changes or redistribute the text.

* Use as copy & paste from many to many text layers

* Translation: Quickly copy text, translate in your favourite tool and paste it back


Why You'll Love It: "Text Repeat Grid" not only enhances your productivity but also integrates seamlessly into your design process, allowing you more time to focus on creativity and less on repetitive tasks.


So, ready to speed up your design process? Give "Text Repeat Grid" a try and watch your efficiency soar!
plugins.tagline: Fill any number of text layers from input, txt file or spreadsheet. Lightning fast tables, grids ...

plugins.name: FigwebX Optimization Design - Convert Figma to your Page Builders without using Auto Layout
plugins.description:
FigwebX is an innovative plugin that empowers users to seamlessly transform Figma designs into fully responsive WordPress and Webflow websites without any coding, all thanks to our state-of-the-art AI technology.


One of its standout features is the integrated multiple platforms. Our integration outputs include:

  1. Gutenberg
  2. Elementor
  3. Bricks
  4. Breakdance
  5. Webflow


Fully customizable output page builders, without any HTML code exports. Futhermore, this tool is automatically optimized for mobile and tablet responsiveness.

To enhance your efficiency in pre-layout, we recommend utilizing this tool to save valuable time.


Documentation: https://softlite.io/docs/figwebx

Email: figwebx-support@softlite.io

Community: https://www.fb.com/groups/softlite.io
plugins.tagline: Best tool for Figma to WordPress conversion without coding

plugins.name: Type Tokens
plugins.description:
How to use:


  1. Open the plugin in the playground file
  2. Copy the type token component to your file (do not change the component hierarchy or layer names)
  3. Using an instance of the component apply your type style to the "Example Text".
  4. Run the plugin and the numbers will be automatically populated to all variants of the component on the current page.


Note: Currently it does not work when type style line-heights are set to auto. Also it will intentionally ignore populating "Font Size" on instances that have the word "clamp" written in them.
plugins.tagline: Document all of your type styles in one place

plugins.name: Old-school Prototyping
plugins.description:
Before Figma, we had an effective method of presenting design mockups to clients. Creating an HTML page and embedding the mockup directly at the center of the page. This method not only allowed us to showcase our designs in a clear and focused manner but also provided a straightforward way for clients to visualize the final product within a web context.


Features:


  • Retro-styled mockup presentation for a classic prototyping experience.


  • Easy replication of horizontal backgrounds with a 1px repeating background image.


  • Downloaded zip file includes a collection of mockup pages(index.html) with links to individual pages.


  • Lightweight and efficient, ensuring smooth integration into modern workflows.


  • Offers a nostalgic yet practical approach to design presentations.


  • A must-have for aficionados of vintage design aesthetics. :)


Here's how you can contribute:

A quick and easy way to show your appreciation for this plugin is by buying me a coffee. This one-time contribution fuels my passion and helps maintain the development of the plugin.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy


Happy Prototyping!

plugins.name: WaveMaker AutoCode
plugins.description:
Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into code. Furthermore the generated code can be easily edited in WaveMaker studio. Binding to backend APIs, customizing the pages with business logic is a cinch.


Apart from Figma design screens becoming pages in your app, the design token variables, and mode from Figma are also translated in the WaveMaker UI Kit. This powers the pixel-perfect translation of designs but also enables customization of the look and feel using the design tokens editor in WaveMaker studio.
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into Angular code.

136573.release_notes:
Better UI, Bug Fixes, and Improved Support for Larger Screens

Table enhancements: Added support for subtext, avatars, and pagination
Left navigation: Now adapts its height class based on whether the page content is scrollable

Breadcrumbs: Now supports two display variants
-Labels and icons
-Icons only

Segmented buttons: Now supports three display variants:
-Labels only
-Labels with icons
-Icons only

Screen size support: Improved layout rendering for wide screens

Additional CSS bug fixes for improved consistency and rendering
136573.tagline: Convert Figma Designs that use popular UI Kits such as Material 3.0 into Angular code.

plugins.name: Tooltipo
plugins.description:
Create beautifully designed tooltips in seconds with Tooltip Generator! This plugin streamlines your workflow by offering real-time preview and comprehensive customization options. Perfect for UI designers, design system maintainers, and anyone looking to add consistent tooltips to their designs.


Detailed Features

â€¢ Live Preview: See your tooltip changes in real-time as you customize

â€¢ Multiple Positions: Choose from top, right, bottom, or left positioning

â€¢ Full Customization: Control colors, padding, font size, corner radius, and pointer size

â€¢ Color Control: Use color picker or input hex codes directly

â€¢ Auto-Layout Ready: All tooltips are created with auto-layout for easy integration

â€¢ Clean Output: Organized layers with proper naming and structure

â€¢ Dark Theme UI: Comfortable interface that matches Figma's dark theme

â€¢ Single-Click Creation: Generate your tooltip instantly with one click


How to Use

1. Set your tooltip text

2. Customize colors using the color picker or hex inputs

3. Choose the pointer position (top, right, bottom, or left)

4. Adjust size settings if needed (padding, font size, corner radius, pointer)

5. Preview your changes in real-time

6. Click "Create Tooltip" to add it to your design
plugins.tagline: A simple way to generate auto-layout tooltips with custom styling and positioning

plugins.name: Copy Paste Styled Text
plugins.description:
Copying text into Figma shouldnâ€™t mean losing your formatting.


ðŸŒŽ Problem We Solve â€”

When you directly copy and paste text from the web into Figma, it usually loses its structureâ€”everything gets flattened into a single, unformatted block of text.


ðŸš€ Our Solution â€”

With this plugin, your text stays formatted exactly as it shouldâ€”headings, bullet points, code styling, you name itâ€”it all remains intact. No more reformatting by hand. Our plugin seamlessly handles styles for:

  1. headings
  2. subheadings
  3. bullet points & lists
  4. code snippets
  5. font weights
  6. bold & italics


ðŸŒ± Get the most out of this plugin with ChatGPT â€”

This also works seamlessly with text documents generated in ChatGPT, Claude, DeepSeek, Gemini, Mistral, Llama, or your favorite LLM of choice.

Whether you're drafting a quick project scope outline or developer handoff notes, simply copy and paste it from your LLM into Figma using this plugin, and your structured document will remain perfectly intactâ€”ready to use without extra formatting effort.


P.S. If you found this plugin useful, check out more of our free resources on our Bento. For updates on new releases, follow @redwood.ux on Instagram!

plugins.name: Column Creator v2 - Auto-layout helper
plugins.description:
ðŸŒŸ Introducing Column Creator v2


ðŸ“Š Design Precision:

Craft pixel-perfect columns of various widths effortlessly.


ðŸ”„ Seamless Edits:

Your design evolves, and so does our plugin â€“ automatic resizing at its best!


ðŸŽ¨ Easy to use:

The plugin makes use of the core features of Figma so you don't have to edit a bunch of settings inside the plugin. It's plug and play on all frames with autolayout!


ðŸ’¡ Unleash Your Creativity:

Our plugin empowers you to focus on what truly matters â€“ your design vision.


ðŸ†•All new in this version:

Easily create designs with multipole widths or all of the same. Use the shortcuts for even faster changes!


How it works - Children inside

  1. Select one or more frames with autolayout enabled
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the items inside to be and click
  4. Watch your item(s) get the width of the selected amount of columns.


How it works - Selection

  1. Select one or more frames within a frame with autolayout enabled
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the item(s) to be and click
  4. Watch your item(s) get the width of the selected amount of columns.


Want to buy me a coffee?

To help as many people as possible I will keep my plugins completely free. But if my plugin helped you and you want to buy me a coffee you can do that here: https://buymeacoffee.com/sven.figma

plugins.name: StackBlitz - design to instant dev environment in a click
plugins.description:
Implementing designs in code becomes much easier when you don't have to manually set up the environment, open and run the project, and search for the correct file. You can have all this work done for you by clicking a link!


How to use the plugin?

  • Make sure Dev Mode is on (â‡§+D)
  • Select a layer
  • Open in the StackBlitz plugin and paste a URL of a repository with the code of your project. You can also use the URL of a specific file within this repository: typically, a component file, for instance: https://github.com/stackblitz/docs/blob/main/.vitepress/theme/components/CardLists/CardList.vue
  • Click the "Create instant environment link" button to have the link generated for the selected layer.


The link is now added to the layer's Dev resources.


When you click it, a new tab will open with the full IDE loaded with your project. If your link included a file, this file will already be open in the editor.


When to use it?

We suggest providing instant environment links, especially for the essential components in your app. The components that might need adjustments in future are good candidates as well.


Generally, every time a developer looks at a component in Figma to make changes in the code, having a resource link handy will make their work so much easier!

plugins.name: AI Icon Finder
plugins.description:
AI Icon Finder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers quickly find the perfect icons using natural language. Simply describe what you're looking for, and our AI will interpret your query and locate the most relevant icons instantly.


How It Works


  1. Type a description of the icon you need (e.g., "payment confirmation" or "shopping cart with items")
  2. Click "Search" and watch as AI interprets your query into relevant keywords
  3. AI Interpreted queries are clickable and using as a search element for better linking over results
  4. Browse the results and preview icons before inserting
  5. Insert directly into your design or copy the SVG with one click
plugins.tagline: AI-powered icon search that understands even the most abstract prompts.

plugins.name: exportColorInGamut
plugins.description:
Figma/Figjam export color in correct gamut


> Note: This plugin is aimed at developers/designers working with a environment/monitor that supports a color space with a wider gamut than sRGB (specifivally p3). Figma running in a browser is limited to sRGB currently, however the desktop app supports the option to use the native OS one. You may need to enable this in the settings under: Figma > Preferences > Color Space > Unmanaged.


Motivation


When working in a wider color gamut (like the display of a modern macbook, supporting p3) and copying colors to be rendered on the web you may find them to look different (notably less saturated), to what you designed. This is to some extent an inevitable consequence of converting to a smaller color gamut (sRGB), as some colors simply cannot be represented there. There are two main strategies, each with benefits and drawbacks, to convert p3 colors to sRGB (or any larger color space to a smaller). Either you scale the colors linearly, always maintaining contrast (so two different colors in p3 will look different in sRGB), but loosing perceptual uniformity (most colors will look notably different, as a consequence of the linear mapping to a smaller color space).


The second approach is implemented in this plugin. There we ensure that a color which is in both color spaces stays perceptually uniform (looks the same), but neglect that on the extreme end of the p3 color space (regarding colors that cannot be represented in sRGB) colors are cut off. So e.g. the reddest red in p3 gets mapped to reddest red in sRGB, but so do all reds in p3 that exceed the reddes red in sRGB.


Implementation

The specific implementation outlined above is by colorjs.io.


Note that this is not the only solution for this problem. As of recently the web is no longer sRGB limited. The new CSS Color Module Level 4 specifies the color() function with which we can represent colors in wider color spaces, when supported. Hence we can use it to more directly "copy" values from figma to the css. Copy is in quotes here because there is no direct copy button in figma to do this. In essence it is a 1 to 1 mapping (of course), only in a slightly different syntax (base 1, instead of base 255). This plugin formats a string containing both approaches, first the new css color() function, then the computed mapping to sRGB. In correct order, so that the sRGB version is used as fallback, if the client browser does not support the new API. Depending on the adaption progress of the CSS Color Module Level 4 spec, you may opt to omit the sRGB version of coverage is sufficiant.


> Note that this plugin is currently only aimed displays/environment using the p3 color space, if you are on a different one (that is supported by colorjs.io, please write me / submit a issue and I will try to make it more modular)


Usage


Select any element, and run the plugin. A string like the following will be copied to your clipboard:


background: rgb(71.942% 0% 5.7326%);
background: color(display-p3 0.6583 0.1125 0.1125);


Limitations


Gradient fills and opacity are not supported yet. If you need them, please write me / submit an issue and I will try to add this feature.


This plugin is intentionally only concerned with filled colors (text, strokes, background...) editable in figma. If you want to export an asset in the correct color space, please refer to Export PNG with Color Profile.

accepted.name: Maximilian Mairinger
accepted.description: Web advocate, passionate about Typescript, image compression, UI design and emergency medicine. Currently, studying AI at JKU.

plugins.tagline: Export colors in wider color space with wider gamut (p3). With properly interpolated sRGB fallback.

plugins.name: Font Manager
plugins.description: You can select any text boxes and change the font of a specific text type. Currently only supports Korean, English, and numerical value.
plugins.tagline: Select a Text box and change the font of selected Text Type!

110510.name: Font Manager
110510.description: You can select any text boxes and change the font of a specific text type. Currently only supports Korean, English, and numerical value.
110510.release_notes:
1. Improved multi-language text detection and font application:
    Added support for Chinese (Traditional & Simplified)
    Added support for Japanese (Hiragana, Katakana, Kanji)
    Added support for Hindi (Devanagari script)

2. Enhanced symbol and number handling:
    Better separation between numerical values and symbols
    More precise detection of special characters and punctuation
    Fixed issues where numbers and symbols were being confused

3. Upgraded text processing algorithm:
    More accurate script detection for mixed-language text
    Better handling of consecutive characters in the same script
    Improved detection of language boundaries in mixed text

Switched from regex-based to Unicode-range-based detection
More efficient text processing with single-pass analysis
Better grouping of continuous text ranges for font application
110510.tagline: Select a Text box and change the font of selected Text Type!
